item.title: 1.6.2 released
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:22, topic:396490”][quote author=.::Ix Miir xI::. link=topic=493661.msg3610135#msg3610135 date=1306507357]

Coon, it shows that if you’re not using the computer u bought the game with.

Well then I have a major problem lol. That computer is fried with the lightning bolt that stuck it.

can’t you just log onto minecraft and download the game from your other computer?
[/quote]
I think Notch actually is doing this via Mac Address. I have already located the class with these strings. I am downloading a deobfuscation program (jad wont recognize it) and will be working to get rid of the annoying strings. Shall I post if I get it working?[/quote]
YES!

Hopefully we get another update to fix the bugs caused by the bug fixes.

Read full topic

item.description:
@xryz wrote:

idk. i found bugs with 1.6.4 i dont think it was ready for release. i created a new world, there is like at least 20 wolfs right where i am. idk if thats a bug or not, but the tall grass i think is glitched or a bug b/c it stick off the block a little bit.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.6.2 released
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Wow, I was considering running vanilla on the server until bukkit is fully updated, but the multiplayer server isn’t even up to running my client on my local computer, it’s laggy, I spent about 5 minutes after login floating in the air being shot at by skeletons while waiting for the ground under my feet to load.

In summary, even the vanilla server is to buggy to use right now. Do they even run a simple check on these things before they release?

Read full topic
